### PR summary [dba4cf367c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14411/commits/dba4cf367cc3412a4e3854ba27473448fc34320a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.Multiset.DershowitzManna`|585|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ DMLT`
`+ DMLT.wf`
`+ DMLT_singleton`
`+ DMLT_singleton_insert`
`+ DMLT_singleton_wf`
`+ TransLT`
`+ acc_cons`
`+ acc_cons_of_acc`
`+ acc_cons_of_acc_of_lt`
`+ acc_of_acc_lt`
`+ dmlt_of_DMLT_singleton`
`+ dmlt_trans`
`+ instWellFoundedDMLT`
`+ transLT_eq_dmLT`
`+ transLT_of_dmLT`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Can you please mark this PR `WIP` or `awaiting-review`? Thanks!
Obviously my review is far from complete, but I'm not an expert here so hopefully someone else will come along, but these will give you something to start with.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15645~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> Thanks for the PR!
> 
> Am I right in saying that `DMLT_singleton` and `TransLT` are auxiliary to the proof? If so, can you make them as well as all lemmas about them `private`?

Thanks about the quick review! Yes, they are auxiliary to the proof. May I ask what do you mean by saying `to make them private`?
I mean replacing `def`/`lemma` by `private def`/`private lemma`

Thanks for the PR!

Am I right in saying that `DMLT_singleton` and `TransLT` are auxiliary to the proof? If so, can you make them as well as all lemmas about them `private`?

It looks like some proofs can be golfed a little bit more, and I'm not sure about the namings/namespaces (might be worth reading the [naming conventions](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) for that), that's the best feedback I can give so far (before a maintainer looks at it)
Thank you! Some comments are general and need to be applied in other places in PR (instead of just committing the suggested portions).

It looks like some proofs can be golfed a little bit more, and I'm not sure about the namings/namespaces (might be worth reading the [naming conventions](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) for that), that's the best feedback I can give so far (before a maintainer looks at it)

Thanks for the PR!

Am I right in saying that `DMLT_singleton` and `TransLT` are auxiliary to the proof? If so, can you make them as well as all lemmas about them `private`?

```suggestion
  Â· simpa
```

```suggestion
      Â· simpa
```

```suggestion
                    have : t âˆˆ ( {y} : Multiset Î±) := Or.resolve_left t_in_Y t_in_newY
```

```suggestion
  rw [H, Multiset.mem_erase_of_ne fun h â†¦ hyp <| id <| Eq.symm h, Multiset.mem_cons]
  tauto
```

```suggestion
  rw [Multiset.count_add, Multiset.count_inter, Multiset.count_sub]
```

```suggestion
    Â· exact l_u
```

```suggestion
    have := le_of_lt l_u
```

```suggestion
    rw [this]
    rw [â† double_split]
    rw [add_comm]
    rw [â† N2_def]
    rw [N1_def]
```
Please put all rewrites in a single `rw` whenever possible. This comment applies in other places in the PR too.
Thanks! One thing I notice is that I can only combine them into two lines but not one and I thought they should be equivalent.

This is interesting! If I had to guess what is going on here: it is probably because `rw` tries `rfl` after the end of the rewrites, and in this case, there are 2 goals, the first goal is being closed by the `rfl` which is called at the end of the first `rw`. This can be verified by replacing the first `rw` with `rewrite`, which rewrites without trying `rfl` at the end. If an error occurred, then my guess above is correct.

Thanks! I think you are right :-)

This: 
`
rw [this,â† double_split]
rw [add_comm, â† N2_def, N1_def]
`
works while

`
rewrite [this,â† double_split]
rw [add_comm, â† N2_def, N1_def]
`
gives an error.
Please use `by_cases` instead of `if ... then`. This applies everywhere in the PR.

```suggestion
                    have x_in_neg_fy : x âˆˆ neg_f y := this â–¸ x_in
```

```suggestion
                      have fy_negfy_X : f y + neg_f y = X := Multiset.filter_add_not _ _
                      rw [â† fy_negfy_X, add_tsub_cancel_left]
```

```suggestion
                    rwa [â† Multiset.mem_singleton]
```
You can replace `simp; assumption` and `rw [...]; assumption` by `simpa` and `rwa`.

```suggestion
  | MLT : âˆ€ (X Y Z : Multiset Î±),
```
Spaces around colons. Also below.

```suggestion
def MultisetLt [DecidableEq Î±] [LT Î±] : Multiset Î± â†’ Multiset Î± â†’ Prop := TransGen MultisetRedLt
```
Spaces between brackets.
I think "Dershowitzâ€“Manna" should be in the filename, and possibly also in the name of the inductive.
`LT` not `Lt`
And in particular please don't differentiate two closely related definitions solely by capitalisation.
What do the numerical suffixes denote?
I already removed the numerical suffix ;-)
Usually we use `zero` in the name, not `0`.
Please move to an earlier file (and double check it doesn't already exist).
Maybe this can be replaced by using [`Multiset.sub_eq_fold_erase`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Multiset/Basic.html#Multiset.sub_eq_fold_erase) instead?
Needs a better name, I think.

This and following need to move to an earlier file. 

Indeed, it may be best to make a separate PR with the basic Multiset material, so it can be reviewed properly separately.
Name should be something like `sub_add_of_le`.
Do proofs like this not work by something close to `ext; intros; simp; omega`? I guess you need to extract the componentwise consequence of the hypothesis too.
The names all need to change, but this lemma needs to be named `X_of_Y` for the appropriate X and Y.
not clear why this needs to be an inductive (with one constructor), couldn't it just be a def?
Yes, you are right! We changed it into a def now.
Also here, why is this a one-constructor inductive without self reference? Seems to complicate things, no?

I'm not 100% sure exactly what the Mathlib convention is, but shouldn't the `Multiset` be a namespace instead of part of the name in CammelCase? i.e. `Multiset.transLT` and `Multiset.DMLT` above, etc?
Sure! We have added the namespace 'Multiset' now;-)
does `aesop?` work (not sure if you want to leave the `aesop` calls, in the same spirit as `simp` vs `simp only`)
Yes, we replaced this with `simp_all only` now.
could this be replaced with a `simp only` (using `simp`)?
Yes!
another instance of an `aesop` call that may be replaced with the result of `aesop?` (I think)
can these be replaced with something like `constructor <;> simpa`? (don't have an enviroment to test this right now)
Yes! `constructor ; simpa only` works.
is this necessary? (would the `apply` below not work without it)?
You are right. It is not necessary;-)
`aesop?`
The alignment looks off ðŸ˜…
Do we need this as a standalone definition?
You are right! The definition is redundant.
Can you quickly explain the definition of the order here?
Did you forget to write something here?
No. I was intended to show the definition comes after this. But now I removed the colon.

We don't indent docstrings
```suggestion
an equivalent (proved later) version of the ordering. -/
```

Prop-valued things should be UpperCamelCased
```suggestion
def DMLTSingleton [LT Î±] (M N : Multiset Î±) : Prop :=
```

```suggestion
    âˆƒ M', N = a ::â‚˜ M' âˆ§ DMLT_singleton M' M âˆ¨ N = M + M' âˆ§ âˆ€ x âˆˆ M', x < a := by
```

Try to follow the line of sight rule. It says that the main branch of your code should be less indented
```suggestion
  exists (Y + (M - {a0}))
  left
  constructor
  Â· rw [h1]
    have : X = (M - {a0} + {a}) := by
      rw [add_comm, singleton_add] at *
      ext b
      simp only [ext, count_cons] at h0
      by_cases h : b = a
      Â· have := h0 b
        simp_all only [ite_true, ite_false, add_zero, sub_singleton, count_cons_self, ne_eq,
          not_false_eq_true, count_erase_of_ne]
      have := h0 b
      simp [sub_singleton]
      simp_all only [â†“reduceIte, add_zero, ne_eq, not_false_eq_true, count_cons_of_ne]
      split at this
      next h_1 =>
        simp_all only [count_erase_self, add_tsub_cancel_right]
      next h_1 => simp_all only [add_zero, ne_eq, not_false_eq_true, count_erase_of_ne]
    subst this
    rw [add_comm]
    nth_rewrite 2 [add_comm]
    rw [singleton_add, add_cons]
  Â· unfold DMLT_singleton
    refine âŸ¨M - {a0}, Y, a0, ?_, ?_, h2âŸ©
    Â· change Y + (M - {a0}) = (M - {a0}) + Y
      rw [add_comm]
    Â· change M = M - {a0} + {a0}
      have this0 : M = X + {a0} - {a} := by
        rw [â† h0, sub_singleton, erase_cons_head]
      have a0M : a0 âˆˆ M := by
        rw [this0, sub_singleton, mem_erase_of_ne]
        rw [mem_add, mem_singleton]
        Â· apply Or.inr
          rfl
        Â· exact fun h â†¦ hyp (Eq.symm h)
      rw [add_comm]
      simp_all [singleton_add]
```

```suggestion
def TransLT [LT Î±] : Multiset Î± â†’ Multiset Î± â†’ Prop :=
  TransGen DMLT_singleton
```
or
```suggestion
def TransLT [LT Î±] : Multiset Î± â†’ Multiset Î± â†’ Prop := TransGen DMLT_singleton
```

```suggestion
  âˆƒ X Y a,
      M = X + Y
    âˆ§ N = X + {a}
    âˆ§ âˆ€ y âˆˆ Y, y < a
```
